$ITRI $MSFT $SBGSY Itron, Schneider Electric expand Microsoft collaboration on Grid Edge The company states: "Itron (ITRI) and Schneider Electric (SBGSY) are expanding their collaboration with Microsoft (MSFT) to deliver a comprehensive Grid Edge Intelligence solution that addresses utility grid visibility and control challenges. This collaboration takes advantage of Itron's distributed intelligence technology, accelerating the path to bring grid edge intelligence to the utility control center. This will improve grid reliability by establishing high-bandwidth, real-time and scalable data integration between the companies' systems and enable the use of AI and big data analytics. For utilities, this means unlocking a range of new use cases that improve overall efficiency of the distribution system, its reliability and service restoration during unplanned events. This collaboration of industry leaders in grid edge intelligence, energy management, automation, AI, data, and analytics will further enable utilities to manage the electric distribution grid with a myriad of use cases that require central control system applications to share enormous amounts of data with low latency. The companies are bringing to market a non-wires solution that addresses utility challenges during a critical period of infrastructure constraints where lead times for components like transformers are upwards of one to two years. With this non-wires solution, utilities can optimize the grid edge and central control system, enhancing grid capacity of utilities' existing infrastructure by as much as 20%, while maintaining grid asset loading within current design limits. The collaboration will integrate Itron's Grid Edge Intelligence solutions, Schneider Electric's Digital Grid solutions, and Microsoft data and AI solutions to facilitate seamless data flow and provide visibility into distribution grid bottlenecks."

ByteDance has been told to find a non-Chinese buyer for TikTok by April 5 or face a U.S. ban on national security grounds that was supposed to have taken effect in January under a 2024 law. Trump is willing to extend the April deadline if an agreement over the social media app was not reached, according to the report. Oracle (ORCL) is considering a proposal for a sale of the U.S. operations of TikTok that would have it provide security assurances and take a small stake in a new American entity while potentially leaving the app's algorithm in Chinese hands, while several other companies have privately expressed interest in participating in a deal for TikTok or its American operations, including Amazon (AMZN) and Microsoft (MSFT), according to previous reports. Companies in the social media space that compete with TikTok include Meta (META), Alphabet's YouTube (GOOGL), Pinterest (PINS), Reddit (RDDT) and Snap (SNAP).

$CRWV $QQQ $ORCL $MSFT $NVDA I can understand why WS views this Coreweave rush to IPO as a red flag for the datacenter buildout. But to their defense, the truth is, there still exists a ridiculous appetite to build out datacenter operations. The amount of issued permits grows seemingly double digits every day. While this is great news for the datacenter plays in general, it's not as great for Coreeweave itself. Their strategic advantage was capacity at a time where capacity was limited. While capacity is still extremely limited and WS underestimates the amount of capacity necessary to enable both ML (training) and inference, Coreweave's strategic advantage is diminishing with every permit issued. Again, this has nothing to do with the hardware input ASP's, because demand is still ridiculously high, but rather, Coreweave's diminishing strategic advantage and a roadmap to its own profitability.

How it started... Remember this video I shared with you 1 month ago here... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pWV5b6SwDsI&t=1s How its going... “Nvidia (NVDA)-backed CoreWeave (CRWV) priced its initial public offering well below the official range...cloud-computing startup had effectively slashed the IPO’s size and price range during the day.” IBD And then there was this… $NVDA which already holds a 5% stake in $CRWV reportedly stepped in with a $250 million anchor investment to bolster the offering. This move was seen as critical, with sources suggesting that without NVIDIA’s support, the IPO might have failed entirely. The situation was described as a “disaster” by some observers, highlighting concerns about demand for AI-related stocks amid a volatile market and broader skepticism about the sustainability of AI infrastructure investments. This narrative was further fueled by reports of $MSFT, a major CoreWeave customer, canceling significant data center leases, raising questions about the startup’s revenue stability

$NVDA Nvidia's H20 Chip Faces Supply Crunch in China Amid Soaring Demand. China's H3C, one of the country's largest server makers and a key original equipment manufacturer for Nvidia's AI chips, warned of a looming shortage of the H20 chip, according to a client advisory cited by Reuters. The H20 is currently the most advanced Nvidia AI chip legally allowed for export to China under United States restrictions. According to the company's advice, H3C's stock of the H20 chip is almost depleted; fresh deliveries are not anticipated until mid-April. The alert ascribed the supply strain to disturbances in raw materials and world trade uncertainty. H3C also said that changing transportation issues and manufacturing limits would keep delivery unpredictable beyond April 20. Rising acceptance of affordable AI models created by Chinese firm DeepSeek has fueled demand for the H20 chip in recent months. $QQQ $MSFT $AMZN $GOOGL

$MSFT OpenAI on Monday announced it had closed what amounts to the largest private tech funding round on record. The $40 billion financing values the ChatGPT maker at $300 billion, including the fresh capital. It’s nearly three times the amount previously raised by a private tech company, according to PitchBook. The valuation puts OpenAI behind only SpaceX at $350 billion and even with TikTok parent ByteDance among the world’s most richly valued private companies, according to CB Insights. Japan’s SoftBank is leading the round with $30 billion, and is joined by a syndicate of other backers, including core investor Microsoft as well as Coatue, Altimeter and Thrive.

It is not yet clear whether the White House has approval for the proposed structure of such an arrangement from China, the author says. Under the president's proposal, TikTok America would be approximately 50% owned by new U.S. investors and license the platform's algorithm from ByteDance, the author says, noting that existing ByteDance investors would have a roughly one-third interest, while ByteDance itself would retain a 19.9% stake. Additionally, Trump reiterated he is willing to offer tariff relief in exchange for China's help approving the eventual sale of the platform by ByteDance but has "no knowledge" Chinese authorities would adopt this approach. This comes a day after Trump reviewed a proposal from a consortium of US investors, including Oracle (ORCL), Blackstone (BX), and venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz that has emerged as a top contender, people familiar with the matter added. The Fly notes that companies reportedly aiming to buy TikTok or invest in a U.S. version of it include Amazon (AMZN), AppLovin (APP), Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Oracle.

$AMZN $APP $META $MSFT $ORCL Ireland's DPC set to impose fine over EUR 500M on TikTok, Bloomberg reports Ireland's DPC will fine TikTok more than EUR 500M before the end of April for illegally shipping European users' data to China, Bloomberg's Samuel Stolton reports. The fine is a result of a lengthy investigation that found TikTok violated the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation by sending user data to China to be accessed by engineers. The decision will likely include an order for TikTok to suspend the unlawful data processing in China within a set timeframe, Stolton writes. Companies reportedly aiming to buy TikTok or invest in a U.S. version of it include Amazon (AMZN), AppLovin (APP), Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Oracle (ORCL).

$NVDA $TSLA $MSFT $AAPL Investment Tip: Why European Investors Should Buy U.S. Stocks Directly With the euro currently strong against the dollar (1 EUR ≈ 1.11 USD), European investors have a unique opportunity. For any U.S. stock listed both in the U.S. and Europe — like NVIDIA, Apple, or Microsoft — buying directly on U.S. exchanges like Nasdaq is smarter. You get better pricing, tighter spreads, and more liquidity. Plus, you fully benefit from today’s favorable exchange rate. Later, if the dollar strengthens again, you can earn additional profits when converting your dollars back to euros. This strategy offers two potential gains: stock price growth and currency appreciation. For long-term investors, now is the perfect time to build positions directly in U.S. markets.

$NVDA $TSLA $MSFT $AAPL Why European Investors Should Buy U.S. Stocks Directly in Dollars European investors can maximize their exposure to U.S. stocks like NVIDIA by buying them directly in dollars on American exchanges. With the euro currently strong (around 1 euro = 1.11 dollars), you receive more dollars for each euro invested. This means you effectively buy more stock for the same amount of euros compared to purchasing the European listing, where currency conversion is already priced in. By investing directly in dollars, you’re putting a larger percentage of your capital into the actual stock, maximizing your potential returns. Later, if the dollar strengthens against the euro, you also gain from currency movements when converting your profits back. This strategy is about smart currency use: stronger euro at entry, stronger dollar at exit. > In short: buying U.S. stocks directly gives you more stock ownership and double the opportunity for gains.

$NVDA $TSLA $MSFT $AAPL Example: €10,000 Investment in U.S. Stocks Current EUR/USD: 1 EUR = 1.0960 USD €10,000 → $10,960 invested If the dollar strengthens: New EUR/USD: 1 EUR = 1.0500 USD Value back in euros: $10,960 ÷ 1.0500 ≈ €10,438 Pure currency gain: €438 (+4.38%), even if stock prices stay flat. Key insight: Buying U.S. stocks in dollars when the euro is strong gives more stock exposure and an extra profit opportunity from future currency moves — ideal for both private and institutional investors.

$SPY $TSLA $QQQ $AAPL $MSFT I'm all for PUTS but PSA for anyone new hoping to cash in tomorrow. Be careful with puts Monday morning. The market is set to gap down hard, and volatility is already elevated. If you’re thinking about buying puts at the open, realize that most of the move may already be priced in. When volatility spikes, put premiums go up — but if IV drops after the open (IV crush), those premiums can fall fast even if the market keeps dipping a bit. Unless you’re already holding puts from before the drop, buying them during the crash probably won’t pay off much, and might even lose value.
